#summary The frame allowtransparency attribute
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute,from-microsoft

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [FrameElement <frame> element] > *allowtransparency attribute*

== Usage ==

Despite the fact that [http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/intro/sgmltut.html#h-3.2.2 HTML attribute names are supposed to be case-insensitive], and despite the fact that [http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms533072(VS.85).aspx MSDN shows a case-insensitive example], the `allowTransparency` attribute must be specified in camel-case in your HTML markup.  Uppercase T, lowercase everything else.  Otherwise it will not be properly [http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/section-elements.html#reflecting reflected] in the DOM.

== Values ==

== Elements ==

You can use the `allowtransparency` attribute on the following elements:

  * [FrameElement <frame>]
  * [IframeElement <iframe>]
